00067 /* Control values that are put in the TREDescription data_type field */
00068 enum
00069 {
00070     NITF_LOOP = NITF_BINARY + 1,    
00071     NITF_ENDLOOP,                   
00072     NITF_IF,                        
00073     NITF_ENDIF,                     
00074     NITF_COMP_LEN,                  
00075     NITF_END                        
00076 };
00077 
00078 /* This can be used if the user wants to loop a constant number of times */
00079 /* Set the TREDescription label to NITF_CONST_N, and the number in the tag */
00080 /* Example: {NITF_LOOP, 0, NITF_CONST_N, "4096"} */
00081 #define NITF_CONST_N    "CONSTANT"          
00082 #define NITF_FUNCTION   "FUNCTION"

00086 struct _nitf_TREHandler;
00091 typedef struct _nitf_TRE
00092 {
00093         struct _nitf_TREHandler* handler;  
00094         NITF_DATA* priv;                   
00095     char tag[NITF_MAX_TAG + 1];        /* the TRE tag */
00096 } nitf_TRE;

00239 
00250 typedef struct _nitf_TREHandler
00251 {
00252     /* The init method gets called when creating a TRE from scratch */
00253     NITF_TRE_INIT init;
00254     
00255     /* The read method gets called when reading a TRE from an IOHandle */
00256     NITF_TRE_READER read;
00257     
00258     /* setField is called by the setField proxy of the TRE API */
00259     NITF_TRE_FIELD_SET setField;
00260     
00261     /* getField is called by the getField proxy of the TRE API */
00262     NITF_TRE_FIELD_GET getField;
00263     
00264     /* find is called by the find proxy of the TRE API */
00265     NITF_TRE_FIND find;
00266     
00267     /* write gets called when writing the TRE to an output IOHandle */
00268     NITF_TRE_WRITER write;
00269     
00270     /* begin is called by the begin proxy of the TRE API */
00271     NITF_TRE_ITERATOR begin;
00272     
00273     /* getCurrentSize is called by the getCurrentSize proxy of the TRE API */
00274     NITF_TRE_SIZE getCurrentSize;
00275     
00276     /* clone is called when a TRE is cloned */
00277     NITF_TRE_CLONE clone;
00278     
00279     /*
00280      * destruct is called when a TRE is destroyed - NOT when the handler is.
00281      * destruct is an optional operation and doesn't need to be provided by
00282      * plug-in implementations
00283      */
00284     NITF_TRE_DESTRUCT destruct;
00285     
00286     /* optional data that contains handler-wide data for supporting TREs of
00287      * the type that the plug-in handles
00288      */
00289     NITF_DATA* data;
00290 } nitf_TREHandler;
00291
